msContents.summary: This inscription, dated to saṃvat 489 records the installation of a Śaṅkaranārāyaṇa statue by Svāmivarta. The text is composed in verse and prose mixed, featuring five verses in four metres: sragdharā (1 verse), mandākrāntā (2 verses), vasantatilaka, and śārdūlavikrīḍita.

handDesc.handNote: description of letters, possibly including letter-heights

history.provenance: The insription is located in the area in front of the West Entrance to the temple.

app.note: records an auspicious symbol at the beginning of the inscription, transcribing it as oṃ. However, no trace is visible.

div.p: “O Śrī Lakṣmī, look at the pair of our Lords, the Bearer of the trident and Holder of the bow, united but not as a couple. What is it that is not easy to achieve for each of the two of them in this world, due to which they have merged into one person Definitely, O Friend, everything is easily achievable for [Śiva], the Enemy of Love!” May there be eternal obeisance to this Half-Viṣṇu-half-Śiva, at whom Bhavanī looked after having spoken these words.

On the second day of the bright fortnight of the first Āṣāḍha month in saṃvat 489, while Bhaṭṭāraka Mahārāja Śrī Gaṇadeva is reigning for an unlimited time, Svāmivārtta, favoured by the supreme devotee of deities Śrī Bhaumagupta, who knows proper conduct, has continuously invested the highest favour in auspicious deeds, and who is born in an exalted family established here for the purpose of accumulating the merit for his deceased mother and father as well as himself the venerable Śaṅkaranārāyaṇasvāmin, who is without beginning or end and constitutes the cause for the genesis, maintenance, and destruction of all worlds. Furthermore,

Devotion towards him, i.e. Śaṅkaranārāyaṇa, who is the Guru of all the three worlds, the abode of blessings, in whom all kinds of prosperity in the form of regulated rewards of deeds are fixed for those who have merit, and who maintains this entire world in its various forms, is never fruitless for those of pure hearts and intentions.

May that single form protect us, which was formed from half of Viṣṇu and half of Śiva in order to remove this bias of those whose mind is confused because of hanging onto a side because the world of men is divided in respect to the nature of devotion to deities, and which is dark and white like a cloud in autumn!

Those who indeed daily perform meritorious deeds that bring happiness in both worlds and are free of vanity, after they enjoy the objects of senses in this world according to the rules, these virtuous reach heaven through their own actions.

The course of men who do evil deeds is downwards and that of virtuous, wise men upwards. Having thus reflected upon this with intelligent mind, with resolved intention this Vārtta, skillful in practicing visible and invisible rites and methods i.e. external and internal established with devotion this image fashioned with half of Viṣṇu and half of Śiva for obtaining his own merit.
